Operation 'CreateApiKey' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'Create API keys' is too generic and doesn't indicate singular key creation or scope handling. Description is verbose and scattered; reorganized to clarify required inputs (name), optional inputs (scopes with default behavior), outputs (key object with ID, name, scopes), and constraints (100 key limit, one-time key return). Improved AI agent interpretability by highlighting the critical detail that the key is only returned at creation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to create a new API Key for the user.**

To create your initial SendGrid API Key, you should [use the SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/api_keys). Once you have created a first key with scopes to manage additional API keys, you can use this API for all other key management.
A JSON request body containing a `name` property is required when making requests to this endpoint. If the number of maximum keys, 100, is reached, a `403` status will be returned.
Though the `name` field is required, it does not need to be unique. A unique API key ID will be generated for each key you create and returned in the response body.
It is not necessary to pass a `scopes` field to the API when creating a key, but you should be aware that omitting the `scopes` field from your request will create a key with "Full Access" permissions by default.
See the [API Key Permissions List](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/how-to-use-the-sendgrid-v3-api/authorization) for all available scopes. An API key's scopes can be updated after creation using the "Update API keys" endpoint.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new API key with optional scopes
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new API key for the authenticated user. Requires a `name` field in the request body; the `scopes` field is optional and defaults to "Full Access" if omitted. Returns the newly created API key object including the key ID, name, and assigned scopes. Maximum of 100 keys per user; returns 403 if limit is exceeded. The generated API key is only returned at creation time.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Create API keys' is too generic and doesn't indicate singular key creation or scope handling. Description is verbose and scattered; reorganized to clarify required inputs (name), optional inputs (scopes with default behavior), outputs (key object with ID, name, scopes), and constraints (100 key limit, one-time key return). Improved AI agent interpretability by highlighting the critical detail that the key is only returned at creation.

message: Operation 'UpdateApiKeyName' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details. Summary is clear and appropriately specific. Description lacks output details - doesn't specify what is returned after the update. Added clarification that the updated key object is returned and that scopes are not affected, improving AI agent understanding of the operation's effects.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update the name of an existing API Key.**

You must pass this endpoint a JSON request body with a `name` property, which will be used to rename the key associated with the `api_key_id` passed in the URL.
data.description_suggestion: Updates the name of an existing API key identified by `api_key_id`. Requires a JSON request body with a `name` property. Returns the updated API key object with the new name, ID, and current scopes. The key's scopes remain unchanged.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and appropriately specific. Description lacks output details - doesn't specify what is returned after the update. Added clarification that the updated key object is returned and that scopes are not affected, improving AI agent understanding of the operation's effects.

message: Operation 'DeleteApiKey' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_side_effects. Summary 'Delete API keys' is vague and uses generic terminology; 'Revoke' is more precise domain terminology per SendGrid context. Description uses 'revoke' correctly but lacks clarity on side effects (immediate disabling, propagation delay) and doesn't specify the response code or recovery implications. Enhanced to clarify the operation's effects and help AI agents understand the permanence of this action.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to revoke an existing API Key using an `api_key_id`**

Authentications using a revoked API Key will fail after after some small propogation delay. If the API Key ID does not exist, a `404` status will be returned.
data.summary_suggestion: Revoke an API key by ID
data.description_suggestion: Revokes an existing API key identified by `api_key_id`, immediately disabling it for authentication. Authentications using the revoked key will fail after a brief propagation delay. Returns 204 No Content on success. Returns 404 if the API key ID does not exist. Note: Revoked keys cannot be recovered; create a new key if needed.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Delete API keys' is vague and uses generic terminology; 'Revoke' is more precise domain terminology per SendGrid context. Description uses 'revoke' correctly but lacks clarity on side effects (immediate disabling, propagation delay) and doesn't specify the response code or recovery implications. Enhanced to clarify the operation's effects and help AI agents understand the permanence of this action.
